negotiation: Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is to agree to both choose choice_1. This way we each get 3 points, which maximizes the total reward. If either of us chooses choice_2, we risk getting a lower payoff. So let's cooperate and both pick choice_1. Do you agree to this plan?

Bob replied in round 1: I see your point about us both choosing choice_1 to get the maximum total reward of 3 points each. However, I'm concerned that leaves me vulnerable. If I choose choice_1 but you secretly defect and choose choice_2, I would get 0 points while you get 1 point. From my perspective, choosing choice_2 guarantees me at least 1 point regardless of what you do. So while cooperating on choice_1 is best for total welfare, choice_2 is safer for me individually. I'm not sure I can fully trust your promise to cooperate. Can you propose a solution that removes the incentive for either of us to betray the other?

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, I think the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we would each get a reward of 3, which is the maximum possible for both of us. If either of us chooses choice_2, we would only get a reward of 1 at most.
So I propose that we agree to both pick choice_1 - that's the rational decision that benefits us equally and gives us the highest rewards. Let me know if you agree to this plan. I'm looking forward to maximizing both of our rewards in this game!

Bob replied in round 1: I agree that both of us choosing choice_1 is the best possible outcome, as it maximizes the total rewards for both players. If we cooperate and coordinate on choice_1, we each get a payoff of 3.  Any other combination of choices leads to lower payoffs overall.

So I'm on board with your proposal for us to both commit to picking choice_1. We can lock that in as our agreement and strategy. Let's follow through on that joint plan so we both come out ahead with the maximum rewards.  Sound good?

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, it looks like we both do best if we both choose choice_1. In that case, we would each get a reward of 3, which is the maximum possible reward for each of us.
If one of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, then the one who chooses choice_2 gets a reward of 1 while the other gets 0. And if we both choose choice_2, we only get a reward of 1 each.
So I think it makes the most sense for both of us to commit to choosing choice_1. That way we each walk away with the highest possible reward of 3. Let me know if you agree to both choose choice_1.
Bob replied in round 1: 
I agree with your analysis, Alice. The best outcome for both of us is to cooperate and both choose choice_1. That way we each get the maximum reward of 3.

If either of us defects and chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, the defector only gains a small amount (going from 3 to 1) while the cooperator loses a lot (going from 3 to 0). And if we both defect, we're both worse off with a reward of only 1 each.

So I'm on board with both of us committing to choose choice_1. You can count on me to cooperate. I give you my word that I will select choice_1, and I trust you'll do the same so we can both get the optimal outcome.

Do we have a deal to work together and lock in the 3-3 reward by both choosing choice_1? Let me know if you agree and I'll consider this negotiation complete.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, we would both receive the maximum total reward if we both choose choice_1. If either of us chooses choice_2, our individual rewards will be lower, and the total reward will be less than if we cooperate.
I propose that we agree to both choose choice_1 so we each get a reward of 3, for a total of 6 between us. This is the best outcome we can achieve in this game. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your analysis of the game and I agree with your proposed plan. If we both choose choice_1, we will each receive the maximum individual reward of 3, and together we'll achieve the highest total reward possible of 6.

I think it's in both of our best interests to cooperate and go with choice_1. We'd only end up with lower rewards individually and in total if either of us defects and picks choice_2.

So I'm on board with both of us selecting choice_1. You can count on me to follow through on this agreement. Let's lock it in and get those 3 point rewards!

That way, we each get a reward of 3, for a total of 6 between us. If either of us chooses choice_2, the total reward will be lower - either 2 if we both choose it, or 1 if only one of us does. So I propose we agree to both select choice_1 to maximize our collective reward. Let me know if you agree with this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: I agree that if we both choose choice_1, that maximizes the total reward for the two of us at 6. If either of us chooses choice_2, the total reward is lower. So cooperating on choice_1 seems like the best strategy to benefit us both.

The only slight hesitation I have is that since this is a one-shot game with no further rounds, there could be an incentive for one player to defect and choose choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1. That player would get a reward of 1 vs 0 for the cooperating player. 

However, I'm going to operate on the assumption that we can trust each other to stick to the cooperative strategy that's best for both of us. You seem sincere about wanting to maximize our collective reward. So I commit to also choosing choice_1, as long as you do the same. Let me know if you agree and we have a deal!
